description: Phase 2: Fix dashboard analytics routing. Bottom metric cards, charts, and session items look clickable but have no navigation. Add proper links and a sidebar entry for monitoring. IMPORTANT: Code is at ventus-voice/frontend/src/ (NOT root frontend/).

userStories.title: Add navigation links to bottom metric cards
userStories.description: As a user, I want the metric cards at the bottom of the Dashboard to navigate to relevant analytics pages when clicked.
acceptanceCriteria: IMPORTANT: Code is at ventus-voice/frontend/src/ (NOT root frontend/)
In Dashboard.tsx around lines 483-590, find the 3 bottom metric cards: Average Duration, Total Spend, API Calls
Each card is a motion.div with cursor-pointer but no navigation handler
Wrap each card in a Link component from react-router-dom (import Link if not already imported)
Average Duration card: Link to /analytics?tab=overview
Total Spend card: Link to /analytics?tab=costs
API Calls card: Link to /analytics?tab=usage
Style the Link with className block (to maintain card layout) and no text decoration
Existing hover animations (whileHover={{ y: -4 }}) should still work on the motion.div inside the Link
Files: ventus-voice/frontend/src/pages/Dashboard.tsx
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Wrapped all 3 bottom metric cards in Link components: Average Duration → /analytics?tab=overview, Total Spend → /analytics?tab=costs, API Calls → /analytics?tab=usage. Link already imported. Used className='block no-underline'. motion.div hover animations preserved inside Links. Typecheck passes.

userStories.title: Add View More links to chart components
userStories.description: As a user, I want to drill down from Dashboard charts to the full analytics view.
acceptanceCriteria: IMPORTANT: Code is at ventus-voice/frontend/src/ (NOT root frontend/)
In CallTrendsChart.tsx, after the </ResponsiveContainer> (around line 76) and before the closing </Card> (line 77), add a footer Link

Use the pattern: <Link to='/analytics?tab=overview' className='block mt-4'><Button variant='ghost' className='w-full justify-center gap-2 text-xs text-muted-foreground'>View All Trends <ArrowRight className='h-3 w-3' /></Button></Link>
Import Link from react-router-dom, Button from ui/button, ArrowRight from lucide-react
In CostAnalyticsChart.tsx, add same pattern after </ResponsiveContainer> (around line 64) with Link to /analytics?tab=costs and text View Cost Details
Files: ventus-voice/frontend/src/components/Dashboard/CallTrendsChart.tsx, ventus-voice/frontend/src/components/Dashboard/CostAnalyticsChart.tsx
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Added 'View All Trends' link to CallTrendsChart.tsx routing to /analytics?tab=overview, and 'View Cost Details' link to CostAnalyticsChart.tsx routing to /analytics?tab=costs. Both use Button ghost variant with ArrowRight icon. Imports added for Link, Button, ArrowRight. Typecheck passes.

userStories.title: Make recent session items clickable
userStories.description: As a user, I want to click on a recent session in the Dashboard to see its details.
acceptanceCriteria: IMPORTANT: Code is at ventus-voice/frontend/src/ (NOT root frontend/)
In Dashboard.tsx around lines 298-350, each session item is a motion.div with cursor-pointer and key={session.id}
Wrap each motion.div in a <Link to={`/sessions/${session.id}`}> component
The Link should have className='block' and no text-decoration (to not affect card styling)
The motion.div inside can keep its existing hover animations and cursor-pointer
session.id is available from the RecentSession data structure
Verify the route /sessions/:sessionId exists in App.tsx (it does at line 279)
Files: ventus-voice/frontend/src/pages/Dashboard.tsx
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Wrapped each session motion.div in <Link to={`/sessions/${session.id}`}> with className='block no-underline'. Moved key prop to Link. Hover animations and cursor-pointer preserved on inner motion.div. Route /sessions/:sessionId already exists in App.tsx. Typecheck passes.

userStories.title: Add monitoring link to sidebar in God Mode
userStories.description: As a technical user in God Mode, I want to access the Monitoring dashboard from the sidebar instead of only through a Dashboard quick action.
acceptanceCriteria: IMPORTANT: Code is at ventus-voice/frontend/src/ (NOT root frontend/)
In Sidebar.tsx, find the navigation items array (look for the array of { to, labelKey, icon } objects)
Add a new entry after the Analytics item: { to: '/monitoring', labelKey: 'monitoring', icon: Activity }
Import Activity from lucide-react (or use Monitor icon if Activity is already imported for something else)
This item should only show in God Mode -- check how other God-Mode-only items are conditionally rendered (look for isGodMode or viewMode checks)
If there is no i18n key for monitoring, use a direct label string 'Monitoring' as fallback
Files: ventus-voice/frontend/src/components/layout/Sidebar.tsx
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Added monitoring nav link after Analytics in Sidebar.tsx with godModeOnly: true. Uses Activity icon from lucide-react. labelKey 'monitoring' already existed in modeLabels. Typecheck passes.
